bibl.author: William Sloane Kennedy
bibl.title: William Sloane Kennedy to Walt Whitman, 13 December 1888
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Whitman wrote a postscript to his December 13, 1888, letter to Richard Maurice Bucke on the back of this letter from Kennedy and then sent this letter as an enclosure to Bucke.

revisionDesc.change: final check, corrected notes on related item

body.p: Did you ever write a production called "Solitude"? It is credited to you by a pencil-script line in the Harvard College Library. I don't believe it is yrs, but that it is an imitation. It is unbound, about 2/3 the size of this sheet, contains 16 pp. & has written on it in pencil "Presented to the Library by Prof. Jas: Russell Lowell, 1860. Sept 26." It is divided into two sections, with running titles "Chamber," & "Street," & begins

lg.l: This agony of a continual presence."

body.p: I shd like to get yr written word on it.
